intro: Rorippa boissieri, commonly known as the narrowleaf watercress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of slender, elongated leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom during the summer months. It is typically found in moist or aquatic environments, such as ponds, ditches, and stream margins. Rorippa boissieri is an annual or biennial herb that is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
